meanings.definition: Behavior or qualities of a hero.
meanings.sent1: His heroisms in the face of danger inspired everyone around him.
meanings.sent2: The book celebrated the heroisms of the main character who always stood up for what was right.
meanings.sent3: The heroisms of the little puppy trying to protect its toy from a big dog were both adorable and brave.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to volunteer work showed heroisms that shone brighter than any medal.
meanings.sent5: The heroisms of the firefighter rushing into the burning building will forever be remembered in our town.

meanings.sent1: The soldier's heroisms on the battlefield saved many lives.
meanings.sent2: People often overlook the everyday heroisms of teachers who inspire their students.
meanings.sent3: The heroisms of the cat bravely facing off against a much larger dog made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: In the face of adversity, her heroisms shone like a beacon of hope.
meanings.sent5: The heroisms of the marathon runner pushing through the pain to reach the finish line were truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a hero.
meanings.sent1: The heroisms of Superman are known worldwide.
meanings.sent2: In movies, we often see characters achieving heroisms in the most challenging situations.
meanings.sent3: The heroisms of the little child dressing up as a superhero for Halloween were adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her heroisms in the face of adversity made her a role model for many young girls.
meanings.sent5: The heroisms of the police officer who saved the kitten from the tree warmed everyone's hearts.
